sub_title: Hydrogen Project Delivery Manager - at Shell
summary:
Mr. Arwin Zijl has over 20 years experience in Engineering Procurement and Construction Projects (Shell, MORSE, Consulting and Fokker). His career has covered positions in Upstream and LNG Capital Project, Aircraft Manufacturing, Consultancy in Engineering Process Management / Project Information Management.
In his 8 years with Shell Arwin worked in Project Services / Project Engineering covering Cost Estimating, Cost Control, Project Planning, Risk Management, Project Reporting, Contracting & Procurement, New Business Development, Project Information Management, Site Management and Interface Management across Shell Businesses. He had led Shell's global discipline network as the Principal Technical Expert for Project Information Management.
Arwin Zijl has managed teams of over 20 people (local and expatriate) in challenging environments.
Mr. Zijl has a Masters degree in Industrial Engineering from the Technical University of Enschede and is a frequent key-note speaker at seminars & conferences.

projects.description: FLNG technology is an important development for the LNG industry as it reduces both the project costs and environmental footprint of an LNG development, because there is no need for long pipelines to shore; compression platforms to push the gas to shore; nearshore works such as dredging and jetty construction; and onshore development such as building roads, laydown areas and accommodation facilities.
